sn12.46:4.2: Then a certain brahmin went up to the Buddha,
sn12.46:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn12.46:5.1: “Master Gotama, does the person who does the deed experience the result?”
sn12.46:5.2: “‘The person who does the deed experiences the result’: this is one extreme, brahmin.”
sn12.46:6.1: “Then does one person do the deed and another experiences the result?”
sn12.46:6.2: “‘One person does the deed and another experiences the result’: this is the second extreme.
sn12.46:6.3: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One teaches by the middle way:
sn12.46:6.5: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.46:6.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.46:6.7: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.46:6.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn12.46:7.1: When he said this, the brahmin said to the Buddha:
sn12.46:7.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
